channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Litter still not cleared ref FS-Case-728009889, 3rd July
item.description:
Hello You replied to my complaint about Winders Road yesterday, saying would be cleaned within 24 hours (ref FS-Case-728009889). It is now a day later and this has not happened! Can you please explain this? I do not understand why, given today is a Thursday when the local area is swept by machine, this did not happen as a matter of course, let alone as per you email stating it would happen within 24 hours. This is totally unacceptable. Winders Road has not been cleaned for weeks, not even days. Why do you continue to ignore this street and the long-suffering residents whose lives are blighted by litter? Please escalate this response and advise what action will be taken.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 49, Winders Road, Battersea, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic Lights Required!, 3rd July
item.description:
There is a significant problem with the single file traffic lane bridge on Maiden Lane. During busy periods traffic build up on both sides of the road with causes drivers to become angry and erratic, this leads to an increase in noise pollution by the use of the drivers horn through frustration. This is a regular occurrence with lines of traffic stretching up to Dartford Road and back to Crayford Way. This could easily be controlled and mitigated by the use of Vehicle-actuated Signals on either side, giving preference to those travelling up Maiden lane. This could further benefit from the installation of double red lines on one side of the carriage way.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maiden Lane, Barnes Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping on Commercial Way, 3rd July
item.description:
We have a big wheelie bin on Commercial Way which is residential use only however people fly tip around it and their rubbish has been left there for weeks. Please can someone come and dispose of it as a matter of urgency? It is starting to smell and as residents of the building right next to it, we are worried it is going to attract pest.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 169, Sumner Road, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 3rd July
item.description:

item.title: Outside school-ark atwood, 3rd July
item.description:
Beside on road bicycle sto rage You have 2 "c" resident parking bays beside each other interrupted by 3 white lines. This is not correct. 3 white lines should indicate a change of bay. In this case it doesn't. And people who have " c" parking permits should be able to park regardless of these white lines- which are an anomaly, I saw my neighbour recieve a penalty parking notice incorrectly. And logically their car was totally in a resident C bay for which they pay to park in. When are you going to finally sort this out ? And incidently when you speak to your parking attendants they too canmot explain your confusing us3 of white lin3s in this specific location. So far I can see-- you haven't yet sent a representative to examine this anomaly. We residents will continue submitting notices until you rectify this situation.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Amberley Road, Maida Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped white goods blocking pavement, 3rd July
